com.lfscheidegger.jfacet

Enum Geometry.PrimitiveType

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.lang.Enum<Geometry.PrimitiveType>
      • com.lfscheidegger.jfacet.Geometry.PrimitiveType
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Comparable<Geometry.PrimitiveType>
    Enclosing class:
    Geometry

    public static enum Geometry.PrimitiveType
extends java.lang.Enum<Geometry.PrimitiveType>
    Specifies how the vertex stream in Geometry is "glued together" to form primitives.

    • Enum Constant Summary

      Enum Constants 
      Enum Constant and Description
      LINE_LOOP
      Draws a line loop by connecting successive vertices, also connecting the last vertex in the stream back to the first.
      LINE_STRIP
      Draws a line strip by connecting successive vertices, without connecting the last vertex in the stream back to the first.
      LINES
      Draws n/2 line segments by connecting pairs of successive vertices in the stream.
      POINTS
      Draws each vertex as a point.
      TRIANGLE_FAN
      Draws a triangle fan centered on the first vertex.
      TRIANGLE_STRIP
      Draws a triangle strip.
      TRIANGLES
      Draws a triangle for every three vertices.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      int glMode

    • Enum Constant Detail

      • LINE_LOOP

        public static final Geometry.PrimitiveType LINE_LOOP
        Draws a line loop by connecting successive vertices, also connecting the last vertex in the stream back to the first.

      • LINE_STRIP

        public static final Geometry.PrimitiveType LINE_STRIP
        Draws a line strip by connecting successive vertices, without connecting the last vertex in the stream back to the first.

      • LINES

        public static final Geometry.PrimitiveType LINES
        Draws n/2 line segments by connecting pairs of successive vertices in the stream.

        This configuration draws a set of disconnected line segments formed by successive pairs of vertices. If the vertex stream is composed of [v0, v1, v2, v3], then this configuration draws two line segments: (v0, v1) and (v2, 3), but it does not draw a line between v1 and v2.

        This configuration assumes an even number of vertices in the stream resolved by the indices in its Geometry.

      • POINTS

        public static final Geometry.PrimitiveType POINTS
        Draws each vertex as a point.

      • TRIANGLE_FAN

        public static final Geometry.PrimitiveType TRIANGLE_FAN
        Draws a triangle fan centered on the first vertex.

        If the vertex stream is composed of [v0, v1, v2, ..., v(n-1)], then this draws triangles of the form (v0, v1, v2), (v0, v3, v4), (v0, v5, v6), etc.

        This configuration assumes an odd number of vertices in the stream resolved by the indices in its Geometry.

      • TRIANGLE_STRIP

        public static final Geometry.PrimitiveType TRIANGLE_STRIP
        Draws a triangle strip.

        The first triangle drawn by this configuration connects the first three vertices in the vertex stream. After these three, each subsequent k-th vertex draws a new triangle of the form (v(k-2), v(k-1), vk).

      • TRIANGLES

        public static final Geometry.PrimitiveType TRIANGLES
        Draws a triangle for every three vertices.

        This configuration assumes that there are 3n vertices, for integer values of n, in the stream resolved by the indices in its Geometry.
